reviewText: If you, like me, are careful how you spend your dvd dollars You will be happy with this one.My Fellow Americans is a gem.  Garner and Lemon are terrific together.  The movie is well scripted, well acted and funny.The American President with Michael Douglas is great.  The widdower president is in a battle for re-election against a "right wing" candidate whom he of course bests.Dave pokes serious fun at the political system which allows a presidential look alike to play president.  The acting is good and the movie is great fun.Wag the Dog is perhaps to possible to be thorouhly enjoyed.  A movie producer is convinced to make a project out of making a false war to promote arms spending which succeeds with frightening ease.  When the producer decides he should get credit fo rhis production, he is kidnapped and unfortunatel found dead of natural causes.  When you buck political power the untimely demise is naturally caused of course.This multi video collection is well worth the price.  Watch it, you will like it.
summary: An exception to the multiple dvd collections

reviewText: This is another gotta have movie, but more for my dad than me. He loves My Fellow Americans (he's a big Grumpy old man fan) and he also got a kick out of Dave. I love the ending of Dave as well as The American President. Good movies.

Title: N/A

reviewText: There are three problems with this disc:1.  The movie "My Fellow Americans" is a 4:3 pan-and-scan hack.  Most folks I know haven't even owned a 4:3 TV for many years, so the phrase "formatted to fit your screen" is just plain backwards.  I really can't imagine why WB would release a DVD in 2012 that isn't a proper widescreen presentation.  For shame.2.  The movie "The American President" is non-anamorphic widescreen (widescreen content within a 4:3 DVD with black bars on top and bottom).  Besides resulting in a lower resolution picture, every time you watch one of these old-style masters, you have to reconfigure your TV to zoom the picture, or you get bars on all four sides.  Is it really so hard to rework this with anamorphic video?  Heck, I'd be happier with it even if you generated the anamorphic video by upscaling from the non-anamorphic.  It would be about ten minutes of somebody's time and three or four hours of re-rendering.3.  The closed captioning on the movie "Dave" (at least on my Blu-Ray player) defaulted to "English" rather than "None", and there was no way to disable it without going through the menu system.  Fixable, but rather annoying.The movies themselves are great.  It's just a shame that WB doesn't actually care enough about their back catalog to treat them with the respect they deserve.

reviewText: This DVD has four movies but I've only seen one so far.  I ordered this because of "My Fellow Americans".  I absolutely love this movie!  The rapport between James Garner and Jack Lemmon is fabulous even though the roles they play (former presidents of differing parties) casts them as two people who can't stand each other.  Then someone sets them both up to take the rap for dirty politics involving kickbacks and other heinous crimes.  The two end up going on the lam together and struggling to survive to find and finger the real culprit(s).  The trip brings lots of action and lots of laughs, but also some pathos for those of us striving to make a life with jobs being scarce and government taking what little money is available.  But don't worry - the laughs far outweigh any angst.This is one of those movies that I hated to see end.  I wanted to see what happened next.  There was real potential here for a sequel, but if there was one made, I never found it.Have fun with this one - it's well worth your time and your money.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I enjoyed two of the three movies I've seen so far, but my complaint is that the package contained only three of the four movies it advertised. It lacked Dave. By the time I discovered this problem, it was too late to try to return it, and the cost of shipping the set back to the seller would have not saved me much money versus just buying a new copy of Dave.In the future, I will avoid purchasing any of the sets in this series.
summary: Good movies that were there, but missing one
Title: N/A
